definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
different/unique/special/very/(classical) to behead/to die/to cut off/to separate/to surpass
to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate

sentences.english: Students receiving special education include those learning in the same class of formal regular junior and primary school students.
sentences.chinese: 特殊教育学生数中包括普通中小学随班就读的学生。

sentences.english: We will also attach importance to pre-school education and care about special education.
sentences.chinese: 重视学前教育，关心特殊教育。

sentences.english: Individualized educational program is a footstone of special education.
sentences.chinese: 个别化教育计划是特殊教育的基石。

sentences.english: We will improve preschool education and develop special education schools.
sentences.chinese: 加强学前教育和特殊教育学校建设。

sentences.english: Individualized teaching is an important way to satisfy student with special educational needs.
sentences.chinese: 个别化教学是满足学生特殊教育需要的重要途径。

sentences.english: China's financial departments provide subsidies for special education.
sentences.chinese: 中国财政部门设立特殊教育专项补贴经费。

sentences.english: Application fields and methods of ICF in special education are also discussed.
sentences.chinese: 本研究还探讨了ICF在特殊教育领域的应用与方法。

sentences.english: Teachers engaged in special education shall enjoy subsidies for special posts.
sentences.chinese: 特殊教育教师享有特殊岗位补助津贴。

sentences.english: Volunteers also help train teachers in primary, secondary and special education schools.
sentences.chinese: 志愿人员还帮助培训中小学和特殊教育学校的师资。

sentences.english: Finally, this paper illustrates the special education he set for the blind and the mutes.
sentences.chinese: 最后，论述张謇为盲哑人所创建的特殊教育。

definition: preschool education/abbr. for 幼兒教育|幼儿教育[you4 er2 jiao4 yu4]
